title: Good to know armor is getting nerfed.
body: Not really. This sucks ass. Why don't people just realize last whisper is one of the most cost efficient items in the game. Tanks are going to be in a horrible spot after this.

You are forced to buy certain items on ADC because the tank is forced to buy certain items to be a tank

Tanks have a choice between choosing to build magic resist, armor and straight up health.

Try making an ADC build that DOESN'T use crits. Wholesale. The two main things ADCs are expected to build are attack speed and damage, and there are a lot of options to do this, but people also expect crits, and your options for crits are extremely limited. I despise using crits because it's a game of chance, and it's been petitioned to be removed because games shouldn't be decided on whether or not the ADC managed to proc a crit; it's the same line of reasoning that led to Dodge being removed a long time ago.

There are a ton of other non-crit items that make a ton of sense for an ADC to build - Maw of Malmortius, Scimitar, Black Cleaver, Wit's End, Zephyr, Iceborne, Manamune, and Essence Reaver to name a few. Try incorporating ANY of these items on anyone who isn't Ezreal or Jayce. People will scream you out of the room.

Tanks have a choice? No they dont. They have to build against the enemy. IF enemy is ad, they build armor, if enemy is ap, they build mag res. Also. Tanks have to build against both types of damage while you have to build only 1 type of damage.

It's not really a choice as much as "build these or become useless".
By not building crit you are merely gimping yourself. It's like arguing how terrible itemization is because you need to build a variety of stats in a balanced way to be effective.
Bruiser items simply don't work on ads because if pushes a good deal of gold into defensive or other secondary stats an adc simply doesn't want.

And if you're unlucky enough, like me, that crits don't proc unless you go 100%, and even then it's a coin toss? I shouldn't have an entire role or class of champion basically off limits simply because of probability. Likewise, someone (read: DRAVEN) shouldn't be allowed to snowball early because he was lucky enough to proc heavy crits frequently very early on, no matter how small that chance supposedly was.

There are merits to building Maw/Scimitar on ADCs, like if the enemy team is mostly composed of mages or one particular one is being a bastard. Crowd control is the ADC's ultimate bane. If Veigar gets you with his stun, normally you're going wait half a minute to get back into the fight, but with a scimitar, you at least have a chance to strike back at him, and Maw dulls the hit and gives you a brief shield to soak up more damage. Hydra is a brawler weapon; Maw and Scimitar are anti-mage weapons, and ADCs bitch ENDLESSLY about how overpowered mages are, even if they just got done saying how trash tier Anivia is.

Crit is simply there to add dps to adcs without giving them reliability to help them scale later. Crits are essentially percentile bonuses to theoretical dps. Crit is a double edged sword where you pour money into it for a chance to hit it big.

There are merits, but the cookie-cutter meta build has more accepted merits. If cc was actually a problem for adcs, cleanse would be popular or they would build mercs/get someone to get crucible.

That's the thing, though. Crowd control is THE universal bane you use against ADCs. Do you expect to outdamage a fed Vayne or Draven? Well, most of the community in this assassin meta would say yes, but crowd control is the one thing that works universally without issue. It's one of several reasons why Braum is so terrifying.

Crowd control > everyone who has no tenacity. I feel like armor hampens adcs more than cc. You'd expect to out burst adcs, as they specialize in sustained damage.

Again, if cc was such a problem, cleanse + both merc items + crucible would be meta and people would actually take cleanse vs morg instead of heal.

AD has basic attacks as well as lifesteal, so they can sustain themselves better HP wise and can get away with running out of mana more easily. AP tends to be more mana dependent so they need mana regen more.

I hope that it's not intended to be like that, though. It limits the variation that AD and AP champions can have when itemization forces them into certain playstyles.

Ehh... well the thing is you don't build armor/mr if you are an AP/AD champion you build it you are against an AD/AP champion
